message: Er, nothing.

action: pauses then sits back to relaxin and preparing food.
gives Biron a confused look, then turns to Quinn.

message: Em sighs ''Last time I was this close to the ocean I was fishing me'self out of it. Pirates you see... damn cut throats and scallywags every one of em.''
I guess... I'm glad for you?
... I almost wish I hadn't joined em.
action: sighs
raises an eyebrow at Quinn.

message: You do have an awful lot of stories.
Part of the joy of being without a roof over the head. Tends to blow a man around like a leaf on the wind.
action: bows his head
cooks up the crabs and fish. and squashes the berry into a jam/juice.

message: Course, now I've found meself a loving family in the Griffon, and no mistake. Blessed I am, for sure.
action: smiles

message: I suppose. I hadn't any experience like that until a couple months ago.
Found yourself working as lookout for a blind pirate captain a couple of months back?
action: raises an eyebrow

message: Er, no... I mean... being on your own, wandering the world and such.
Best way to learn.
action: grumbles
clears their throat.

message: That's what being in the company is to me, anyway.

action: gets up and goes to sit by the shore before waiting for an answer.

message: Well, ya not on your own none now, ya family, friend! Like it or no!
action: grins and slaps Orin on the back
sighs as his hand whistles past the departing Orin.

message: The fish broth Biron prepares goes down easier than the seagull. And guards against the chilling night are creeping into the cave. You all feel the warmth of a good meal sitting in your guts as the weariness of your limbs commands attention.

action: lays on his back on the sand, one hand on his full belly and drifts off to sleep.
shouts to the others:

message: I'll take first watch.

action: turns back to watch the waves.
looks slightly surprised by this.
gets lower to the floor and nods.

message: I'll take second.
Biron seems to fall asleep immediately, as is his manner. Soon followed by a weary Quinn. And so Orin's watch begins.
It is roughly midnight when Orin wakes Biron for his watch, nothing untoward other than flocks of birds having troubled their watch.
And so, in the pitch of night Biron wakes Quinn for the last watch before falling dead asleep again.

action: grunts and dons his armour then slumps down in the low entryway with his bow over his lap.

message: At first much seems quiet. Gulls screech. The waves crash. It is peaceful, if cold.
Then you hear... something.
At first Quinn think it is then wind but as the sound gets louder... yes... it is clear... someone whistling a jaunty tune!

action: crawls back into the cave and shakes Biron, then Orin.

message: Wake up, someone comes!
The pair wake with a start, a little weary to be startled at such an hour.

action: wakes eyes wide and whips up to a (very tight) crouch position.
grabs their bow and arrow, sneaking up to the edges of the cave, watching.

message: The tide is still high, but with the little light from the embers of your fire you can see the narrow beach is empty.

action: gestures to Orin to pull back a lil.

message: The sound of whistling is getting closer... and higher... it appears to be coming from the cliffs above: someone walking along the coastal path?
But who would be travelling at this hour?

action: puts finger to his lips and pulls his shield off his back. presses against the walls of the cave.

message: Well, sounded like a person, could be the wind whistling through the nooks and crinnies of the cliff some though...
action: grins apologetically
lowers his voice and grins at Biron.

message: I'm going to look.
Do you recognise the tune?
action: looks at Quinn and whispers.
listens intently.
puts his hand towards Orin.
crouches, nearly crawling along the cliffside...

message: Let me try. you keep your bow on me.
Now that Biron mentions it, it does sound familiar to Quinn. Perhaps a seafaring shanty, though Quinn cannot quite put his finger on which.

action: looks at Biron with concern.

message: Okay.

action: nods to him.

message: You can now see a glow coming from the bluffs above, as though from a lantern.
It wavers about in the air, as though the holder is walking .
Sounds a bit like 'the fisherman's daughter'. You know it? It's a bit of a bawdy song, and no mistake. You'd know the chorus - makes it clear that shes the easiest catch some...
action: scratches his head
creeps from the cave and up slowly towards the sound.
draws his bow and knocks an arrow, squinting to try and keep his eyes on Biron.
tosses sand on the fire's coals.

message: Biron cautiously climbs the rocks leading back up to the path, quickly and quietly for a man of his size.

action: stays low and stays close to the rock face.

message: Coming along the coastal path you spy what appears to be a man wearing a tricorn hat. He carries a lantern hanging from the end of a long pole.
However, it is not him whistling!!
Upon his shoulder sits a black crow, whistling a tune like any human might.

action: crouches low to the ground and behind some rocks and bushes and keeps an eye on them.

message: As he approaches you can see the man is clearly much enjoying his stroll. He swings his arm and steps forward as though without a care in the world, in tune to the crow's whistling.
A nasty looking mace hangs from his belt, but then who wouldn't carry a weapon in such a remote spot as this?

action: looks for any tattoos, symbols or markings on the stranger or his weapons.

message: Nothing else untoward. He bears leather armour, and a coat that has seen better days. Its pockets jangle, perhaps with coin?

action: lays in waits. Looks down back to Orin to see how far away they are.

message: The man with the tricorn hat continues to pass by without a fuss, the whistling and light dimming into the distance.
Biron waits a while before he moves... but not before he catches a glimpse of something else moving down the path: four large folks, brandishing maces follow close behind, with obvious ill intent!
They do not appear to have seen you, but are following the man along the path.

action: stays silent and watches.

message: The four men pass by, treading softly and carefully after the man with the crow.
They soon disappear into the night as well.

action: moves back to the cave.

message: Anything of import?
action: looks to Biron

message: Nothin we need worry about.
action: grunts
furrows their brow at Biron.

message: Ye ain't coming closer guv'nor.
action: mutters

message: COMMONWEALTH TRAITOR!

action: whispers:

message: Slowly.
We're being followed.
